channel.title: Should MoparScape vets only vote?
channel.description:
That seems more legitimate than me than allowing Community Members from moparisthebest.com in on the vote, however MoparScape Vets that were upgraded to community member such as Miss Silabsoft for instance will still be allowed to see and participate in these votes.
(both user groups will still see the vet talk section)
I will only take into account opinions from MoparScape Vets on this, which is why I did not put a poll.

item.title: Should MoparScape vets only vote?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Greeny:

Well atleast if you fuck up you can only blame yourselves.

I don’t think that’ll happen. Not like you’re expecting it to, at least.

Most of the people that are/have been Vets are well aware of what happened with the rep when the Moparscape CM rank still existed.
I’m sure that the current Vets will maintain a highly conservative approach when inducting new members into their ranks.

The only problem is that a few of them nominate people simply because they’re their friends.
I hope that the members I’m referring to here (and I’m sure they know who they are) will choose to nominate based on ability, rather than inability paired with friendship.

Read full topic

Only MoparScape Vets can vote now, currently there are 2 community members that can also vote (silab and evil) if you are a community member and think you should have voting access as well, get a current vet to nominate you and you can be voted in just like everyone else. (both can still see this section)

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=246574.msg2104877#msg2104877 date=1205354562]

Tico135, in all seriousness. Which would you say is harder? Community member == 50 rep on mitb, took Evil_ nearly… 2? years. MoparScape Vet (or MoparScape CM), took Evil_ a day.

Sorry to use Evil_ as an example, but he’s the only one I know that much about, as I am a stalker.
[/quote]Just because it’s harder to get it doesn’t mean it’s a higher rank, at least to me.
[/quote]yeah, its a higher rank because we get more access

That just shows you completely missed the point of what I was saying.

that is probably because i didnt read any of your posts[/quote]

Which is why you are a fucking pathetic asshole.

And also which is why we are again going off topic. Honestly, WHO THE FUCK CARES about stupid ranks. If you really do care, gtfo off of this website. You are then acting as bad as those rep leechers who only care about getting high rep or gaining moderator.

item.description:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:56, topic:184875”]Tico135, in all seriousness. Which would you say is harder? Community member == 50 rep on mitb, took Evil_ nearly… 2? years. MoparScape Vet (or MoparScape CM), took Evil_ a day.

Sorry to use Evil_ as an example, but he’s the only one I know that much about, as I am a stalker.[/quote]

That is not the point Yz. The point is, is that you all should be working together as one team, not fighting with each other about which rank is better. I don’t care which rank is better, and you shouldn’t either. This is just an argument that has gone on too long.

item.title: Should MoparScape vets only vote?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Some how this topic was turned into a topic about whos a moparscaper and who isn’t. That really should not be an argument, especially since you are either a CM or Vet. I, and probably everyone would agree that discussions should be a lot more meaningful then this has become. Sorry if I’m sounding like a bit of a dick, but it’s true. Members of such a high class as yourselves should be setting examples for the other members, and acting responsibly.

Sometimes I think these types of arguments are because one rank is better then the other rank. Neither rank is better, they are both equal (CM and Vet) it’s just how you look at it. Of course CM’s will say CM is better, and Vet’s will say Vet is better. It’s just an opinion, and people should not be judged by that kind of rank. The entire staff ('m including CM’s and Vet’s when I say this) should act as a team together, and not trying to start fights with other people.

So please, lets keep this type of thing out of future discussions, it gets us no where, and fighting over which rank is better is just a waste of time. You are one team, act as a team, or stay out of discussions.

Read full topic

item.title: Should MoparScape vets only vote?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:48, topic:184875”]Om I am popular.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2008, 01:19:36 AM[/size][hr][quote author=God of Ikiliki link=topic=246574.msg2097075#msg2097075 date=1205036812]

The only way you can become a Vet nowadays is by flaming moparscapers (as Yz85Racer has done countless times, gaining himself Vet).

Agreed
[/quote][quote author=Taharok link=topic=246574.msg2097050#msg2097050 date=1205036425]

Plus, you can’t have a moparscape mod that actually knows Java.

why the hell not?

Because of the lack of Java knowledge here. The tutorial section is 100% filled with topics that do not follow the conventions, thus every topic should be locked. This would piss moparscapers off and make the community go into another shit hole. So, you cannot have an active moparscape moderator who knows Java (rephrased).

Greeny has a very valid point.

Having a larger influx of users able to access this section/nominate people will inevitably bring about an even larger influx again.
When Mopar decided to make both myself and Silabsoft vets (this was quite a while ago), along with deciding to remove the Moparscape CM rank, the two of us chose people that we saw fit, and the goal was to keep it highly exclusive.

There was never an intention for people to be able to access this section/rank unless they truly did deserve the spot, and certainly never an intention for people to be able to get their friends into this somewhat exclusive ‘club’ just because they’re good mates.

The removal of Community Member voting would lower the standards required for this section - nobody can deny that, because I’ve seen many a time when someone has voted ‘yes’ for someone that I, and many others, deem unworthy.
The question you guys have to ask yourselves is “Do we want that? Do we want every man, woman and child to be a part of this higher echelon?” - and that is what you guys are a part of, a higher echelon in the community.

Just remember this - with every extra person that is granted access to this section, your voting power will diminish a bit.
And trust me, with all of the yes voting the vets do, there’s going to be a lot of extra people.

You have the best point, Lothy. The CMs will definitely have a great standard for voting, but will they be fair? I have yet to see a poll where the Vet was not ‘mates’ with a CM or two. The only way you can become a Vet nowadays is by flaming moparscapers (as Yz85Racer has done countless times, gaining himself Vet).
[/quote]
Shut up fags, you’re only saying that because you don’t like me.[/quote]

No, you also do flame moparscapers.

Read full topic

item.title: Should MoparScape vets only vote?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer

Om I am popular.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2008, 01:19:36 AM[/size][hr][quote=“God of Ikiliki, post:33, topic:184875”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=246574.msg2097050#msg2097050 date=1205036425]

[/quote]

Plus, you can’t have a moparscape mod that actually knows Java.

why the hell not?
[/quote]

Because of the lack of Java knowledge here. The tutorial section is 100% filled with topics that do not follow the conventions, thus every topic should be locked. This would piss moparscapers off and make the community go into another shit hole. So, you cannot have an active moparscape moderator who knows Java (rephrased).

Greeny has a very valid point.

Having a larger influx of users able to access this section/nominate people will inevitably bring about an even larger influx again.
When Mopar decided to make both myself and Silabsoft vets (this was quite a while ago), along with deciding to remove the Moparscape CM rank, the two of us chose people that we saw fit, and the goal was to keep it highly exclusive.

There was never an intention for people to be able to access this section/rank unless they truly did deserve the spot, and certainly never an intention for people to be able to get their friends into this somewhat exclusive ‘club’ just because they’re good mates.

The removal of Community Member voting would lower the standards required for this section - nobody can deny that, because I’ve seen many a time when someone has voted ‘yes’ for someone that I, and many others, deem unworthy.
The question you guys have to ask yourselves is “Do we want that? Do we want every man, woman and child to be a part of this higher echelon?” - and that is what you guys are a part of, a higher echelon in the community.

Just remember this - with every extra person that is granted access to this section, your voting power will diminish a bit.
And trust me, with all of the yes voting the vets do, there’s going to be a lot of extra people.

You have the best point, Lothy. The CMs will definitely have a great standard for voting, but will they be fair? I have yet to see a poll where the Vet was not ‘mates’ with a CM or two. The only way you can become a Vet nowadays is by flaming moparscapers (as Yz85Racer has done countless times, gaining himself Vet).[/quote]
Shut up fags, you’re only saying that because you don’t like me.
